description.translate: The Ramayana is an ancient Indian epic that teaches dharma, truth, devotion, and righteousness through the life of Lord Rama.

role.translate: Prince of Ayodhya, avatar of Vishnu, embodiment of dharma.
Wife of Rama, symbol of purity and devotion.
Devotee of Rama, symbol of strength and devotion.
King of Lanka, symbol of ego and adharma.

desc.translate: King Janaka’s kingdom, birthplace of Sita.
Rama is born to King Dasharatha in Ayodhya.
Rama goes to forest for 14 years.
Rama defeats Ravana and rescues Sita.
Rama rules Ayodhya with justice and peace.

description.translate: The Bala Kanda describes the birth, childhood, education, and marriage of Lord Rama.

story.translate: Sage Valmiki asks Narada who the greatest man is. Narada tells him about Rama, a perfect man who follows dharma.

kids.translate: Narada tells Valmiki about good Prince Rama.

lesson.translate: A good person always follows dharma.

story.translate: King Dasharatha performs a sacrifice. With divine blessings, Rama and his brothers are born.

kids.translate: Rama is born with God’s blessing.

story.translate: Rama grows up as a kind, brave, and obedient prince loved by all.

lesson.translate: Good behavior earns love and respect.

story.translate: Rama and Lakshmana go with Sage Vishwamitra to protect sacrifices from demons.

lesson.translate: Protecting good people is our duty.

story.translate: Rama defeats demons like Tataka and Subahu using divine weapons.
Rama travels to Mithila to attend Sita’s swayamvara.
Rama lifts and breaks Lord Shiva’s bow, winning Sita’s hand.
Rama and Sita are married in a grand ceremony.

lesson.translate: Marriage is a bond of love and duty.

story.translate: Rama returns to Ayodhya with Sita and his brothers.

description.translate: Ayodhya Kanda tells the story of Rama’s exile, Bharata’s devotion, and the pain and sacrifice of the royal family.

story.translate: King Dasharatha decides to crown Rama as king. The people of Ayodhya rejoice.

kids.translate: Everyone is happy that Rama will be king.

lesson.translate: Good leaders are loved by all.

story.translate: Queen Kaikeyi reminds Dasharatha of two boons. She asks Bharata to be king and Rama to go to the forest for fourteen years.

kids.translate: Kaikeyi asks Rama to go to the forest.

lesson.translate: Wrong desires can cause great pain.

story.translate: Rama calmly accepts exile to keep his father’s promise. Sita and Lakshmana decide to go with him.

kids.translate: Rama happily accepts the forest life.

lesson.translate: Keeping one’s word is true dharma.

story.translate: Dasharatha is heartbroken and soon passes away, remembering Rama.
Bharata returns from his uncle’s kingdom and is shocked to learn what happened.
Bharata goes to the forest and begs Rama to return and rule. Rama refuses politely.

kids.translate: Bharata asks Rama to come back.

lesson.translate: Duty is greater than personal comfort.

story.translate: Bharata places Rama’s sandals on the throne and rules as a servant of Rama.

description.translate: Aranya Kanda describes Rama’s life in the forest, the conflict with demons, and the abduction of Sita by Ravana.

story.translate: Rama, Sita, and Lakshmana live peacefully in the forest, visiting sages and protecting them from danger.

kids.translate: Rama lives happily in the forest.

lesson.translate: Peace comes from a simple life.

story.translate: The demoness Surpanakha tries to marry Rama. When rejected, she attacks Sita and is stopped by Lakshmana.
Maricha appears as a golden deer. Rama follows it, leaving Sita alone.

lesson.translate: Illusion can distract even the wise.

story.translate: Ravana kidnaps Sita and takes her to Lanka.
The bird Jatayu fights Ravana to save Sita and sacrifices his life.

description.translate: Kishkindha Kanda tells how Rama meets Hanuman, helps Sugriva regain his kingdom, and begins the search for Sita.

story.translate: Hanuman meets Rama and Lakshmana and recognizes Rama as divine. A deep friendship begins.

kids.translate: Hanuman meets Rama and becomes his friend.

story.translate: Rama promises to help Sugriva defeat his brother Vali and regain the throne.
Rama defeats Vali, freeing Sugriva from fear and injustice.

kids.translate: Rama defeats the bad king Vali.

story.translate: Sugriva becomes king of Kishkindha and promises to help find Sita.
Vanara armies are sent in all directions to search for Sita.

description.translate: Sundara Kanda focuses on Hanuman’s heroic journey to Lanka, his meeting with Sita, and his fearless devotion to Rama.

story.translate: Hanuman remembers his powers and leaps across the ocean to reach Lanka.
Hanuman secretly enters Lanka and observes its strength and beauty.
Hanuman finds Sita in Ashoka Vatika, sad but faithful to Rama.
Hanuman gives Rama’s ring to Sita, giving her hope.

kids.translate: Sita feels happy seeing the ring.

story.translate: Hanuman burns parts of Lanka to show Rama’s power.

description.translate: Yuddha Kanda describes the great war between Rama and Ravana, ending with the victory of dharma.

story.translate: Rama builds a bridge across the ocean with the help of the vanara army to reach Lanka.

kids.translate: Rama builds a bridge on the sea.

story.translate: A fierce war begins between Rama’s army and Ravana’s forces.
Kumbhakarna fights bravely but is defeated by Rama.
Rama defeats Ravana after a long battle, restoring peace and justice.
Sita is rescued and reunited with Rama.

description.translate: Uttara Kanda describes Rama’s return to Ayodhya, his righteous rule, Sita’s final trial, and the lasting legacy of Rama.

story.translate: Rama, Sita, and Lakshmana return to Ayodhya. The people celebrate with joy. Rama is crowned king.

kids.translate: Rama comes back home and becomes king.

lesson.translate: Good deeds are rewarded in time.

story.translate: Rama rules the kingdom with justice, kindness, and fairness. People live happily and safely.

kids.translate: People are happy under Rama’s rule.

lesson.translate: A good ruler cares for everyone.

story.translate: To clear doubts, Sita proves her purity and later chooses to return to the Earth.
Rama continues to guide the world as an ideal of dharma, even after his earthly life.

kids.translate: Rama teaches us how to live.

sankshepa_ramayanam.title: Saṅkṣepa Rāmāyaṇa (Śataśloki Rāmāyaṇa)
sankshepa_ramayanam.source: Valmiki Ramayana – Bala Kanda, Sarga 1 (Narada–Valmiki Samvada)

description.translate: Narada Maharshi narrates the entire Ramayana to Sage Valmiki in exactly 100 slokas.

description.translate: A very simple, child-friendly version of the Saṅkṣepa Ramayana, based on Narada’s 100-śloka narration.

stories.story_en: Story 1: This part tells a small and simple event from Rama’s life, teaching children to be kind, brave, and truthful.
stories.story_te: కథ 1: ఈ భాగంలో శ్రీరాముని జీవితంలోని చిన్న సంఘటనను పిల్లలకు సులభంగా చెబుతూ, దయ, ధైర్యం, సత్యం నేర్పిస్తుంది.
